attributes.action: Enforce manufacturers/suppliers to highlight new, smaller, lighter products.
attributes.additional_details: The practice is a  surreptitious, underhanded way of companies charging higher prices for their goods without the customer being aware of the price rise for the product.
attributes.background: Bring in legislation to prevent customers from being duped into paying the same, or higher prices, for smaller, lighter, or fewer quantities.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. 

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The size of products and their prices are a matter for manufacturers and retailers. The Competition and Market Authority is responsible for tackling unfair behaviour, and people can report competition and consumer issues here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/tell-the-cma-about-a-competition-or-market-problem
